Metadata.title: Vicente Gabriel Gómez Medina | .NET Backend Developer
Metadata.description: Portfolio of Vicente Gabriel Gómez Medina, a .NET Backend Developer specializing in robust and scalable solutions.

Profile.greeting: Hello, I'm Vicente Gabriel Gómez Medina
Profile.title: .NET Backend Developer
Profile.description: Passionate about transforming ideas into robust and scalable software solutions. My focus is on clean architecture, performance, and creating APIs that power exceptional user experiences.

csharp.title: C# & .NET
csharp.description: Building robust and scalable backend services and APIs with the .NET ecosystem.

javascript.title: JavaScript
javascript.description: Versatile language for dynamic and interactive web frontends.

react.title: React
react.description: Creating modern, fast, and scalable user interfaces with this powerful library.

typescript.title: TypeScript
typescript.description: Enhancing JavaScript with static types for more reliable and maintainable code.

tailwind.title: Tailwind CSS
tailwind.description: A utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom user interfaces.

sql.title: SQL & Databases
sql.description: Designing and managing relational databases, primarily with SQL Server.

achievements: Led the migration of a monolith to a microservices architecture, improving scalability and reducing deployment time by 40%.
Designed and implemented a caching system with Redis that decreased API latency by 60% for the most frequent queries.
Automated the CI/CD pipeline with Azure DevOps, enabling faster and more reliable software deliveries.
Participated in the development of a web application with ASP.NET MVC, contributing to a 15% increase in customer satisfaction.
Optimized complex SQL queries, resulting in a 30% reduction in critical report loading times.
Implemented unit and integration tests, increasing code coverage from 20% to 75% in key modules.

educationData.degree: Higher Degree in Web Application Development

educationData.institution: University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria

volunteeringData.description: Guiding future developers through mentoring, sharing best practices and career advice.
Collaborated on logistics to ensure a smooth experience for over 500 attendees.

eventsData.name: Annual Developers Conference
eventsData.description: Attended as a participant, joining talks on the latest trends in software development, serverless, and microservices architecture.

eventsData.name: Social Innovation Hackathon
eventsData.description: Part of a team that developed an application prototype to connect volunteers with local NGOs, winning second place.

project1.title: Project Alpha
project1.description: A high-performance RESTful API built with .NET 7 to manage customer data, optimizing queries by 50%.

project2.title: Project Beta
project2.description: Migration of a monolithic application to a microservices architecture, improving scalability and maintainability.

project3.title: Project Gamma
project3.description: Development of a real-time data processing system using SignalR and message queues for instant notifications.
